message.content:
Salvia mexicana is a plant species that belongs to the mint family. 
It is commonly known for its medicinal properties and used in traditional Mexican medicine. 
The plant has dense, hairy and aromatic green leaves that grow on tall erect stems. 
Salvia mexicana blooms in late summer to early fall, producing striking dark blue-purple flowers on long spikes. 
The plant requires full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. 
Salvia mexicana can be found growing in the wild in Mexico, Central and South America. 
It is also cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes around the world.
